perturbation.original_text: Subject to the provisions of this Agreement and all applicable Laws, Transporter shall accept and transport Shipper's Crude Petroleum and redeliver the quantity of Crude Petroleum received by Transporter, less applicable Losses as set forth in Section 7.3, at the Delivery Point. Transporter shall be under no obligation to deliver the identical Crude Petroleum received, and reserves the right to make delivery out of its common stock.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the provisions of this Agreement, Transporter will endeavor to accept and transport Shipper's Crude Petroleum and redeliver a quantity of Crude Petroleum, less potential Losses as generally described in Section 7.3, at the Delivery Point. Transporter shall be under no obligation to deliver the identical Crude Petroleum received, and may attempt to make delivery out of its common stock.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the legal obligation by replacing 'shall accept and transport' with 'will endeavor to accept and transport' and 'shall be' with 'may attempt to be,' making the action discretionary rather than mandatory. The wording 'potential losses as generally described' reduces the clarity of the obligation to redeliver. This contradicts the common carrier obligation often imposed on pipelines under state and federal law, requiring them to provide transportation services without undue discrimination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common carrier obligations under Texas law, specifically the Texas Natural Resources Code.

perturbation.original_text: Shipper, upon request by Transporter, shall install, maintain and operate, or make arrangements with platform owners to install, maintain, and operate equipment to inject corrosion inhibitors, biocides, scale inhibitors, paraffin chemicals, or other chemicals as specified by Transporter.
perturbation.changed_text: Shipper, upon request by Transporter, should consider installing, maintaining, and operating, or explore making arrangements with platform owners to install, maintain, and operate equipment to inject corrosion inhibitors, biocides, scale inhibitors, paraffin chemicals, or other chemicals as possibly specified by Transporter.
perturbation.explanation: This change reduces the binding nature of the obligation by replacing 'shall install, maintain and operate' with 'should consider installing, maintaining and operating' and 'as specified by Transporter' with 'as possibly specified by Transporter'. This introduces ambiguity and makes the requirement to inject chemicals discretionary rather than mandatory which may conflict with regulations related to pipeline integrity and environmental protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 49 CFR Part 195 - Transportation of Hazardous Liquids by Pipeline (federal regulations regarding pipeline safety).

perturbation.original_text: Shipper shall furnish, or cause the producer from which Crude Petroleum is purchased to furnish to Transporter, the following information at least 24 hours in advance of start of production from any well which has been acidized: (i) estimated time of first production from acidized well; (ii) estimated time that first production from acidized well, which has been neutralized to a pH equal to or greater than 4.5, will be injected into the Gathering System; and (iii) estimated time that produced fluids from previously acidized wells, which has been neutralized to a pH equal to or greater than 4.5, will be free of neutralized acids.
perturbation.changed_text: Shipper should attempt to furnish, or encourage the producer from which Crude Petroleum is purchased to furnish to Transporter, information regarding production from any well which has been acidized. The information may include: (i) a rough estimate of when production will start from the acidized well; (ii) a general idea of when production from the acidized well, neutralized to a pH around 4.5, will be injected into the Gathering System; and (iii) a vague timeframe for when fluids from previously acidized wells, neutralized to an approximate pH of 4.5, will be free of neutralized acids.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the requirement to provide information by replacing 'shall furnish' with 'should attempt to furnish' and making the timing and specificity of the information optional. This could contradict requirements related to preventing pollution or damage to the pipeline system from unneutralized acids.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Clean Water Act and related state regulations regarding the discharge of pollutants.
